title: Tony Dungy refuses to share if he voted for Belichick, Kraft on Hall-of-Fame ballot
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Tony Dungy, a Hall of Fame voter, declined to reveal if he voted for Belichick or Kraft.
Belichick and Kraft, influential in New England's success, weren't elected into the 2026 Hall of Fame class.
The Pro Football Hall of Fame Class of 2026 will be announced at the NFL Honors event on Thursday.

title: ‘You changed my life’: Cory Durden’s Cinderella season continues with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Cory Durden emerged as a key defensive player for the Patriots, contributing significantly in his first full season.
Durden was signed from the practice squad in August and played in all 17 regular-season games, earning significant snaps.
He has recorded 30 tackles and a 72.8 Pro Football Focus grade, ranking 20th among defensive linemen in 2025.

title: Payton Pritchard thrives in return to bench as Celtics roll over Mavericks: 6 takeaways
author: Tom Westerholm
bullets: Payton Pritchard returned to the bench and scored 26 points as the Celtics beat the Mavericks 110-100.
Jaylen Brown led Boston with 33 points and 11 rebounds, extending his double-double streak to five in eight games.
Cooper Flagg, who grew up a Celtics fan, scored 36 points for the Mavericks and nearly avoided a blowout.

title: Recent homes sales in Greater Boston (Feb. 4)
author: The Boston Globe
bullets: Abington homes ranged from $370,000 for a 3-bedroom ranch to $720,000 for a Cape Cod style house.
In Arlington, a two-family building on Newport Street sold for $1,155,000, while condos on Massachusetts Ave. sold for over $1 million.
A Boston high-rise condo on Dalton Street sold for $9.5 million, making it the most expensive sale in the area.

title: Manhole fires on Newbury Street prompt building and street evacuations
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Six manholes exploded on Newbury Street, causing evacuations from Gloucester to Dartmouth Street, according to fire officials.
The Boston Fire Department attributed the explosions to an electrical issue; no injuries were reported during the incident.
Streets, including sections of Newbury, Dartmouth, and Exeter, were closed as a response to the manhole fires.

title: South Station’s new fare gates still out of service more than a week after snow storm
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: South Station's fare gates remain closed over a week after Boston's severe snowstorm.
Boston received 16 to 23 inches of snow on Jan. 25-26, affecting South Station's new fare gates.
Keolis and Scheidt & Bachmann are working to restore the $1.3 million gates installed in December.

title: Devin McCourty on ’25 Patriots: ‘A lot different than us’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Devin McCourty praises the 2025 Patriots for their belief and preparation under coach Mike Vrabel.
The Patriots, led by MVP candidate Drake Maye, reach Super Bowl LX despite a challenging past season.
McCourty notes the team's methods and mentality differ from past dynasties, embracing a lighter, focused approach.

title: Woman who posed as student at Boston high schools accepts plea deal, sentenced to probation
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Shelby Hewitt, 34, pleaded guilty to five charges for enrolling as a student at three Boston high schools.
Hewitt was sentenced to four years of probation and must pay over $9,000 in restitution as part of her plea deal.
She is prohibited from Boston Public Schools and future social work employment, following her use of aliases and forged documents.

title: BPS pauses new hiring amid deficit as district predicts hundreds of layoffs next year
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston Public Schools impose partial hiring freeze due to a projected $53 million budget deficit for the current fiscal year.
Three schools in Boston are set to close by 2027, affecting up to 400 educator jobs, due to declining enrollment.
Increased costs in health insurance, transportation, and special education contribute to the Boston school district's financial challenges.

title: From SNL-style ‘Weekend Updates’ to a TD Garden beer chug, Will Campbell isn’t afraid to bring the laughs
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Patriots coach Mike Vrabel enlisted rookie Will Campbell for humorous 'Weekend Update' recaps, inspired by SNL, to engage players.
Campbell entertained TD Garden fans by removing his shirt and chugging a beer during a Celtics-Heat game in December.
Campbell overcame an MCL sprain and played a pivotal role in improving the Patriots' offensive line this season.
